WorkItem.Description:
Every time I try to use the Fill Socket for Rawr, it gives me an error that gives me the option of closing it or completely ignoring the error and forgetting I tried to use the Fill Socket command.
Unrelated, but might as well save space/time here, but Rawr loads/edits items really slowly, has it always been this way? I've only found out about it today.

Comments.Message:
Fill Sockets being broken is know, and fixed for the next version.

Can you give some more details about 'really slowly'? What exactly are you doing that takes longer than you expect, and exactly how long is it taking? What are your system specs?

Um, there's not much to saw as how it's slow. Every time I try to edit an item(such as manually replacing gems), the box/window/whatever it is that lets me do this takes at the minimum 10 seconds(sometimes even 20+) every time, even if I close and re-edit the same item.
My specs are alright, nothing to write home about. 1.5 GB ram, 2.8 GHz, Radeon X1950 video card, I think that's all the relevant specs, right?

So it's just on opening the Item Editor? OK, I reworked the way it loads icons in the item editor (that's what was taking so long), so it should be much better in b14. What other operations are especially slow for you?
That was the only thing that was slow, I'll try the new version and see if that helps.
Whoops, new version isn't out yet. >.>
